Package dev.orphoros.demo.amalgamlib.controllers

Class AuthorController

  • java.lang.Object
    • dev.orphoros.demo.amalgamlib.controllers.AuthorController
  • @RestController
@RequestMapping("/authors")
@CrossOrigin(origins="*",
             allowedHeaders="*")
public class AuthorController
extends java.lang.Object
    Author controller

    This class is responsible for handling GET, PUT, POST and DELETE requests.

    The author controller is being mapped under the /authors path. The controller can only work with Json objects

    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Orphoros
    See Also:
    Author, AuthorService, AuthorRepository

    • Method Detail

      • getAuthorByID

        @GetMapping("/{authID}")
public Author getAuthorByID​(@PathVariable
                            java.lang.Long authID)
        GET Mapping for Author using author ID

        Allows to retrieve an author from the central database.

        Implementation Note:
        An author may be accessed by calling /authors/012345 where the number in the path is the author ID.
        Parameters:
        authID - path variable ID of the author to retrieve
        Returns:
        Author by its corresponding author ID

      • getAllAuthors

        @GetMapping
public java.util.List<Author> getAllAuthors​(@RequestParam(required=false)
                                            java.lang.Boolean male,
                                            @RequestParam(required=false)
                                            java.lang.String name)
        GET Mapping for Author

        Allows to retrieve a list of authors based on request parameters. All the parameters are optional and one may select any number of them in any order in the request.

        Implementation Note:
        A list of authors may be accessed by calling /authors.
        Parameters:
        male - Optional request parameter to filter by gender
        name - Optional request parameter to filter by name containing a keyword
        Returns:
        List of found authors based on the request parameters

      • addNewAuthor

        @PostMapping(consumes="application/json")
@ResponseStatus(CREATED)
public Author addNewAuthor​(@RequestBody
                           Author a)
        POST Mapping for Author

        Allows to add a new Author to the database using Json.

        Implementation Note:
        A new author may ge provided in the request body of the POST request in Json format under the path /authors.
        Parameters:
        a - Author to add to the database in Json format from the request body
        Returns:
        Author copy of the newly saved author if succeeded

      • deleteBook

        @DeleteMapping("/{authID}")
@ResponseStatus(NO_CONTENT)
public void deleteBook​(@PathVariable
                       java.lang.Long authID)
        DELETE Mapping for Author

        Allows to delete an existing author based on the author ID

        Implementation Note:
        An author may be deleter under /authors/012345 where the number in the path is the ID of the author to delete
        Parameters:
        authID - path variable ID of the author to delete

      • updateBook

        @PutMapping("/{authID}")
public Author updateBook​(@PathVariable
                         java.lang.Long authID,
                         @RequestBody
                         Author a)
        PUT Mapping for Author

        Allows to update an existing author's details using its corresponding author ID

        Implementation Note:
        An author may be updated under the path /authors/012345 where the number in the path is the ID of the author to update. A request body containing the same ID must be present as well!
        Parameters:
        authID - path variable ID of the existing author to update
        a - Json formatted author in the request body with the updated details containing the author ID
        Returns:
        Author copy of the saved and updated author if succeeded
